description: More than 50 other countries have already banned the substance, which has been known to lead to lung and ovarian cancer, mesothelioma and other deadly illnesses.
title: The U.S. bans most common form of asbestos, after decades of pushback from industry

description: At issue was a sweeping Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals decision that barred government officials from having contacts with social media platforms.
title: Supreme Court seems wary of barring government contacts with social media

description: Charlotte the stingray in a small North Carolina aquarium has been attracting visitors since she got pregnant without a mate. Businesses in Hendersonville are delighted by the influx.
title: Pregnant stingray Charlotte brings in traffic, business to North Carolina town

description: Trump's lawyers say they've approached 30 companies through four brokers and none will accept his real estate holdings as a guarantee on the bond and argue the judgment is unconstitutionally high.
title: Trump unable to post $450M bond in New York fraud case, his lawyers say

description: NPR correspondent Sarah McCammon grew up in a white evangelical church that taught her to never question her faith. She was later surprised by the community's overwhelming support for Donald Trump.
title: An 'exvangelical' on loving, leaving and reporting on the culture of Christianity

description: Joann expects to receive $132 million in new financing as part of the bankruptcy agreement. The Ohio-based company will also be delisted from the Nasdaq stock exchange.
title: The arts and crafts giant Joann files for bankruptcy, but stores will remain open

description: Physician Céline Gounder traveled to India and Bangladesh to bring back unheard stories from the eradication of smallpox,, many from health workers whose voices have been missing from the record.
title: The improbable victory over smallpox holds lessons for health threats in 2024

description: The mysterious ailments that became known as Havana syndrome left no physical evidence of injury or disease, according to two government studies.
title: In Havana syndrome patients, NIH scientists find no physical trace of harm

description: Putin hails his victory in a Russian election with no real opposition. The Supreme Court will hear arguments in a case that examines whether the government can combat misinformation online.
title: Putin wins Russian election; Supreme Court tackles misinformation, censorship case

description: The Israeli military said it was "operating to thwart terrorist activity" at Al-Shifa Hospital. The Gaza Ministry of Health says the raid violates humanitarian law.
title: Israel's military launched an overnight raid on Gaza's largest hospital

description: With NCAA brackets formed, the college basketball tournaments dubbed March Madness because of its drama begin this week. Here are some highlights to watch for as the men's and women's games begin.
title: Let the madness begin: 3 things to watch at the NCAA basketball tournaments

description: In an interview with NPR, Ford says it was only a couple of years ago that she felt ready to revisit how her life was upended by Brett Kavanaugh's rise to a position on the U.S. Supreme Court.
title: Christine Blasey Ford aims to own her story with 'One Way Back'

description: Vladimir Putin won a landslide reelection victory, taking some 87% of all ballots following three days of voting derided by Russia's opposition and the West as neither free nor fair.
title: After a quarter century in power, Russian President Putin isn't going anywhere

description: Americans consume more than half their daily calories from ultra-processed food. A new study finds consuming lots of this food is linked to a higher risk of many diseases.
title: From anxiety to cancer, the evidence against ultra-processed food piles up

description: Arizona holds a presidential preference election to choose how its delegates will be awarded. That means independents don't get to vote - in a state where they are a third of the electorate.
title: In Tuesday's 'primary', Arizona's independent voters don't get much of a say

description: When the April 8 solar eclipse draws eyes upward, having proper solar filters and solar eclipse glasses is essential to avoid potentially permanent eye damage, doctors say.
title: Watching a solar eclipse without the right filters can cause eye damage. Here's why

description: The plaintiffs in the lawsuit are Missouri, Louisiana and five individuals who were either banned from social media during the pandemic or whose posts, they say, were not prominently featured.
title: Supreme Court examines whether government can combat disinformation online

description: India goes to polls in a month in the world's largest elections. Here are three things to know about the contest that could see Prime Minister Narendra Modi winning a third term.
title: What to know as India sets elections for April

description: More than 30 U.S. citizens were on the government-chartered flight, officials said in a statement. It later arrived at the Miami International Airport.
title: First charter flight with U.S. citizens fleeing Haiti lands in Miami
